feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 02 at 4:02PM AKST until March 04 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THURSDAY TO MIDNIGHT AKST THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. Northerly winds 30 mph, gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Pribilof Islands. * WHEN...From 2 PM Thursday to midnight AKST Thursday night.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 4:01PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS AND BLOWING SNOW FOR THE NORTHERN BRISTOL BAY COAST THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY MORNING... A developing low pressure system entering the eastern Bering Sea Thursday afternoon will produce strong winds and the potential for blowing snow for portions of the Bristol Bay region Thursday evening through late Friday morning. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 3:48PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storm Impacting NorthWest Alaska Friday... A strong storm bringing winds, snow and blowing snow will move north over the West Coast of Alaska on Friday. There is a possibility that this storm could bring blizzard conditions to the Northwest Alaska Friday into Saturday. A weaker storm will move north over Northwest Alaska on

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 02 at 1:40PM PST until March 05 at 1:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Winter weather returns to Sierra Late Thursday through Saturday... .A weather system will move through California late week, bringing light Valley rain and mountain snow back to NorCal. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 8:01PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TONIGHT... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 10:37PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SLIPPERY TRAVEL POSSIBLE EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... A period of snow will overspread interior Massachusetts between midnight and 2 AM. Precipitation will likely be in the form of mainly rain along the south coast, with a mix of snow and rain across northern CT into RI and southeast Massachusetts, then ending as a period of snow toward daybreak Thursday. entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued March 02 at 2:18PM CST until March 04 at 7:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN STACK OF COUNTIES IN THE TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening.

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Little in the way of rain forecast for the next few days. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 2:20PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAINFALL HAS LED TO AN INCREASED THREAT OF LANDSLIDES AND DEBRIS FLOWS IN WESTERN WASHINGTON... Rainfall of as much as 3 to 10 inches over the past several days has increased soil moisture to high levels across western Washington. This amount of rain has put extra pressure on soil instability, leading to an increased threat of landslides and

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 02 at 10:34AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...RISING RIVER LEVELS THROUGH THURSDAY DUE TO RAIN AND HIGH SNOW LEVELS... For the Foothills of the northern Blue Mountains, the northern Blue Mountains and the Grande Ronde Valley. Southwest flow will continue to bring periods of rain to northeast Oregon and southeast Washington through Thursday afternoon.
